result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Hefflin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid $25 per month commencing 04/01/2021 or penalty of civil judgment entered for non payment. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court grants 2 days credit. TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D Hefflin

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:23 AM Defendant Michael D Hefflin in court with attorney Eryn M Menden in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared by Zoom (video) for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense recites plea agreement.  Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Cases 14CM97, 14CT876 and 15CM60 dismissed and read in to this matter.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
2 Days Jail.  (Credit - 2 days).  COURT DEEMS TIME SERVED.

COSTS: $ 243.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $ 25.00  per month commencing 4/1/21.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.

Hearing on February 18, 2021 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on February 23, 2021 at 08:30 am.

Defense requests the 14CM97 matter be set for trial.  Jury trial expected to last 1 day.  All other matters to tag along for further scheduling.  Hearing scheduled for February 18, 2021 at 09:30 am.
